events.title: Adoption of the American Flag
events.description: The Continental Congress passed the Flag Resolution establishing the United States flag with thirteen stripes and thirteen stars.
events.significance: This event marked the official creation of the American flag, a symbol of unity and independence for the new nation.

events.title: Storming of the Bastille Initiated in Paris
events.description: Although the main storming occurred on July 14, initial tensions and events leading to the French Revolution were set during this period in June.
events.significance: Marked the beginning of a period of revolution and radical political change in France, influencing global ideas about democracy.

events.title: Winston Churchill's 'Finest Hour' Speech
events.description: Churchill gave a stirring speech to the House of Commons as France was falling to Nazi Germany.
events.significance: This speech rallied British morale during World War II and symbolized steadfast resistance against Nazi Germany.

events.title: Founding of the United States Army
events.description: The Continental Congress established the Continental Army, appointing George Washington as its commander.
events.significance: Marked the formation of the army that would fight in the American Revolutionary War and later become the U.S. Army.

events.title: The Gold Standard Act Passed in the United States
events.description: The United States officially adopted the gold standard, establishing gold as the only standard for redeeming paper money.
events.significance: This act stabilized the U.S. economy and international trade by backing currency with gold reserves.
